an10.65:1.1: At one time Venerable Sāriputta was staying in the land of the Magadhans near the little village of Nālaka.
an10.65:1.2: Then the wanderer Sāmaṇḍakāni went up to Venerable Sāriputta and exchanged greetings with him.
an10.65:1.3: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, Sāmaṇḍakāni sat down to one side, and said to Sāriputta:
an10.65:2.1: “Reverend Sāriputta, what is happiness and what is suffering?”
an10.65:2.2: “Rebirth is suffering, reverend, no rebirth is happiness.
an10.65:2.3: When there is rebirth, you can expect this kind of suffering.
an10.65:2.4: Cold, heat, hunger, thirst, defecation, and urination. Contact with fire, clubs, and knives. And relatives and friends get together and annoy you.
an10.65:2.5: When there is rebirth, this is the kind of suffering you can expect.
an10.65:2.6: When there is no rebirth, you can expect this kind of happiness.
an10.65:2.7: No cold, heat, hunger, thirst, defecation, or urination. No contact with fire, clubs, or knives. And relatives and friends don’t get together and annoy you.
an10.65:2.8: When there is no rebirth, this is the kind of happiness you can expect.”
